title: Interactive Education Program Based on Ultrasound Anatomy Practical Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Anatomy and Medical Device Usage Experience
context.additional_context: Practice-centered training for current professionals, featuring small-group activities using digital devices and formative assessment focused on feedback

learning_goals: Learners can identify normal and abnormal anatomical features of human structures (heart, liver, kidneys, etc.) with 80% accuracy using ultrasound equipment
Learners can explain ultrasound images in connection with anatomical theories (muscle layers, vascular distribution, etc.) in over 70% of cases
Learners can accurately manipulate ultrasound probes to scan over 90% of target tissues during peer practice sessions
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
